greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Same-tree Moebius function of the multiorder of integer partitions indexed by Heinz numbers.
comment: The Heinz number of an integer partition (y_1,...,y_k) is prime(y_1)*...*prime(y_k).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
formula: mu(y) = Sum_{g(t)=y} (-1)^d(t), where the sum is over all same-trees (A281145, A294019) whose multiset of leaves is the integer partition y, and d(t) is the number of non-leaf nodes in t.
program: A056239(n) = { my(f); if(1==n, 0, f=factor(n); sum(i=1, #f~, f[i,2] * primepi(f[i,1]))); }
muifbalancedfactorization(v) = if(!#v, 1, my(pw=A056239(v[1]), m=-1); for(i=1,#v,if(A056239(v[i])!=pw,return(0), m *= A294080(v[i]))); (m));

A294080aux(n, m, facs) = if(1==n, muifbalancedfactorization(Vec(facs)), my(s=0, newfacs); fordiv(n, d, if((d>1)&&(d<=m), newfacs = List(facs); listput(newfacs,d); s += A294080aux(n/d, m, newfacs))); (s));
A294080(n) = if(1==n,0,if(isprime(n),1,if(mapisdefined(map294080,n), mapget(map294080,n), my(v=A294080aux(n, n-1, List([]))); mapput(map294080,n,v); (v)))); \\ _Antti Karttunen_, Sep 22 2018
results.author: _Gus Wiseman_, Feb 07 2018
